SEARCH
Package entities.scoring

Class Scoring

java.lang.Object
entities.scoring.Scoring
public class Scoring extends Object
Handles the end-of-game scoring logic for both local and online games. This class takes care of all the steps needed to finish a game and figure out how many points each player has earned. It includes things like asking players to discard cards, flipping majority card sets face-down for their respective players, figuring out who has the most of each card color, and calculating final scores. There are two main entry points: - calculateScores(List<Player> players) is used in local games. - calculateScoresOnline(List<Player> players) is used in online games, and returns a SocketPacket so results can be sent to each player. Key things this class does: - Ask each player to discard two cards from their hand. - Tally up all collected cards and award bonuses for majorities by color. - Count up everyone's points and print them out (or send them over the network). Depends on: - Player – represents each player in the game. - Card – represents a card in the game (with color, value, and flipped state). - SocketPacket – used to send scoring results in online games. Assumes that all normal gameplay (drawing, playing cards, etc.) is finished. This class just wraps up the round and tells everyone how they did.

      public Scoring()

  • Method Details

    • calculateScores

      public static Player calculateScores(ArrayList<Player> players, boolean isTwoPlayerGame)
      Runs the full scoring process for a local game. Players discard their cards, majority colours are worked out, cards are flipped if needed, and scores are calculated and shown.
      Parameters:
      players - All the players in the game
      isTwoPlayerGame - True if it's a 2-player game, affects majority rules
      Returns:
      The player who won, or null if it's a tie

    • calculateOnlineScores

      public static SocketPacket calculateOnlineScores(ArrayList<Player> players, boolean isTwoPlayerGame)
      Handles the score calculation for online games. Assumes discards already happened. It figures out majorities, flips cards, then builds a packet with the results and winner info for the client.
      Parameters:
      players - List of players still in the game
      isTwoPlayerGame - Whether it's a 2-player game (used for rules)
      Returns:
      A SocketPacket with game over message and scores

    • promptDiscard

      public static void promptDiscard(ArrayList<Player> players, boolean isTwoPlayerGame)
      Gets each player to discard 2 cards from their hand. For computer players, it auto-discards. For real players, it prints the hand, takes input, and updates the cards.
      Parameters:
      players - List of all current players
      isTwoPlayerGame - Whether or not it is a 2-player game

    • determineMajorities

      public static Map<String,Integer> determineMajorities(ArrayList<Player> players, boolean isTwoPlayerGame)
      Determines which player has the majority for each card colour.

      This method loops through all players and counts how many of each colour card they've collected. For each colour, the highest count found becomes the "majority" for that colour. If multiple players have the same number, it still counts as a majority, but this method just returns the highest value – not who owns it.

      For figuring out who should have their cards flipped down later in the scoring phase.

      Parameters:
      players - the list of all players in the current game
      isTwoPlayerGame - true if it's a 2-player game (majority is calculated with a 2 card surplus)
      Returns:
      a map where the key is a colour (String) and the value is the highest number of cards any player has for that colour

    • flipCards

      public static void flipCards(ArrayList<Player> players, boolean isTwoPlayerGame, Map<String,Integer> colourMajorities)
      Flips cards face down for players who have majority in any colour. In 2-player games, a player needs 2+ of a colour to gain majority. Otherwise, they just need the highest count.
      Parameters:
      players - list of players
      isTwoPlayerGame - special case rules if true
      colourMajorities - a map of which colour has what majority

    • displayScores

      public static Player displayScores(ArrayList<Player> players, boolean isTwoPlayerGame)
      Calculates everyone's score, prints it, and figures out the winner. Cards flipped face down only count as 1 point. If scores are tied, whoever has fewer cards wins. If that's tied, there is no winner.
      Parameters:
      players - list of players
      isTwoPlayerGame - true if 2-player rules should apply
      Returns:
      the winner, or null if it's a tie

    • displayScoresOnline

      public static SocketPacket displayScoresOnline(ArrayList<Player> players, boolean isTwoPlayerGame)
      Online version of score display. Builds a string with scores and winner info. Works the same as local scoring, but sends the output as a SocketPacket for sending over the network. Also updates the high score DB if needed.
      Parameters:
      players - players in the online game
      isTwoPlayerGame - true if it's a 2-player game
      Returns:
      a SocketPacket with score info and winner message

    • getValidCardIndex

      public static int getValidCardIndex(Scanner sc, int maxSize, String prompt)
      Helper method to get a valid card index from user input. Keeps asking until the user gives a number within range. Adjusts for player input from counting from 1.
      Parameters:
      sc - Scanner to read user input
      maxSize - max number allowed (hand size)
      prompt - message to show to the user
      Returns:
      valid index (adjusted to start counting from 0)
